msg: Transferred from the Adobe Open Source Subversion Repository
1st pass of rename according to the spec http://opensource.adobe.com/wiki/display/flexsdk/Dropping+the+Fx+Prefix

Flex now requires CSS Style declarations to declare @namespace rules and disambiguate between halo and spark components using CSS 3 namespace prefixes on type selectors. At compile time, this namespace information will be used to map type names to qualified ActionScript class names. At runtime, type selectors are matched on qualified ActionScript class name (for example mx.controls.Button rather than just Button). Flex 3 applications must be compiled with -compatibility-version=3.0.0 to get unqualified CSS type selector behavior.
QE: Yes, this build may help in updating test cases to use the new namespaces and class names.
Transferred from the Adobe Open Source Subversion Repository
Initial checkin for FxVideoDisplay.  FxVideoDisplay is the new skinnable video component in Gumbo.  VideoElement is the new chromeless video component in Gumbo.
As part of this checkin, a new swc was added to the libs directory, videoPlayer.swc, which holds the underlying FLVPlackback VideoPlayer we are using today in VideoElement.
Multi-bit rate support hasn't been added yet, the skin could use a lot of work, and work needs to be done on state/skinstate support.  Otherwise, most things should be working.
QE Notes: You can start testing :-)
Transferred from the Adobe Open Source Subversion Repository
Adding SpriteVisualElement, a light-weight, Sprited-based implementation of IVisualElement.  This will be used for some FXG compiler optimizations.

Added setter for includeInLayout into IVisualElement so that DataGroup's virtualization code can use this, rather than cast it to a UIComponent.  I also removed an unused method in DataGroup: _removeChild.  We needed this before to remove children on a previously parented DataGroup, but now that we do the cleanup pro-actively, this is no longer needed.
Also a few ASDoc cleanups in IVisualElement, ILayoutElement, and FxDataContainer.
tests: checkintests, mustella list, datagroup, fxdatacontainer, buttonbar.  Some mustella were failing, but I think it's just a mac thing.
Transferred from the Adobe Open Source Subversion Repository
Default button support for Spark containers and editable text controls.
Transferred from the Adobe Open Source Subversion Repository
Working version of DropDownList (non-editable ComboBox) and its base class DropDownBase. It currently only supports very basic functionality.
- No support for selectedIndex, labelField, labelFunction

Adding new component PopUp. This component is used to position a dropDown in layout. Since a dropDown is added to the display list via the PopUpManager, it doesn't normally participate in layout. The PopUp component is a UIComponent that does get added to a container and thus is laid out. It is responsible for then sizing and positioning the dropDown relative to itself.
The PopUp implementation is very early prototype from Ely. Don't expect anything but the basic case to work.
